intro: Acer prolificum, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged fruits that disperse its seeds. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and parks for its aesthetic appeal.
